q: You are not only responsible for what you say, but also for what you do not say.

h:

q: Unless you're ashamed of yourself now and then, you're not honest.

q: Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get.

q: Life happens in the river, not the shore.

q: The real measure of your wealth is how much you'd be worth if you lost all your money.

q: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.

q: A different result requires doing something different.

q: To find yourself, think for yourself.

q: Still your waters.
h:
“Still your waters.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Follow the man who seeks the truth; run from the man who has found it.
h:
“Follow the man who seeks the truth; run from the man who has found it.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
h:
“Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Great things happen to those who don't stop believing, trying, learning, and being grateful.
h:
“Great things happen to those who don't stop believing, trying, learning, and being grateful.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Working hard for something we don't care about is called stress: Working hard for something we love is called passion.
h:
“Working hard for something we don't care about is called stress: Working hard for something we love is called passion.” —
Simon Sinek

q: Fallacies do not cease to be fallacies because they become fashions.
h:
“Fallacies do not cease to be fallacies because they become fashions.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: The only thing more frustrating than slanderers is those foolish enough to listen to them.
h:
“The only thing more frustrating than slanderers is those foolish enough to listen to them.” —
Criss Jami

q: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.
h:
“The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: We will now discuss in a little more detail the Struggle for Existence.
h:
“We will now discuss in a little more detail the Struggle for Existence.” —
Charles Darwin

q: If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.
h:
“If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.” —
Henry Ford

q: You live by what you thrill to, and there's the end of it.
h:
“You live by what you thrill to, and there's the end of it.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.
h:
“Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Problems remain as problems because people are busy defending them rather than finding solutions.
h:
“Problems remain as problems because people are busy defending them rather than finding solutions.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Every adversity, every failure, every heartbreak, carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.
h:
“Every adversity, every failure, every heartbreak, carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
h:
“Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: If there's a definition of freedom, I think it's this: living life on your terms.
h:
“If there's a definition of freedom, I think it's this: living life on your terms.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
h:
“The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.” —
Carl Jung

q: Each time we don't say what we wanna say, we're dying.
h:
“Each time we don't say what we wanna say, we're dying.” —
Yoko Ono

q: Without the confidence, nothing can be accomplished.
h:
“Without the confidence, nothing can be accomplished.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
h:
“We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Good luck is opportunity meeting preparedness.
h:
“Good luck is opportunity meeting preparedness.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.
h:
“Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Don't ever save anything for a special occasion. Being alive is the special occasion.
h:
“Don't ever save anything for a special occasion. Being alive is the special occasion.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak. Courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
h:
“Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak. Courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.” —
Winston Churchill

q: It is in changing that we find purpose.
h:
“It is in changing that we find purpose.” —
Heraclitus

q: We lie the loudest when we lie to ourselves.
h:
“We lie the loudest when we lie to ourselves.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
h:
“He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.” —
Lao Tzu

q: There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure.
h:
“There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Always try to be a little kinder than necessary.
h:
“Always try to be a little kinder than necessary.” —
James Matthew Barrie

q: Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.
h:
“Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.” —
Sydney Smith

q: May you live all the days of your life.
h:
“May you live all the days of your life.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: Enjoy when you can, and endure when you must.
h:
“Enjoy when you can, and endure when you must.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: Rather than waste time and energy worrying, use that time and energy to constructively deal with whatever is causing the worry.
h:
“Rather than waste time and energy worrying, use that time and energy to constructively deal with whatever is causing the worry.” —
Celestine Chua

q: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, learning from failure.
h:
“There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, learning from failure.” —
Colin Powell

q: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
h:
“He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.” —
Socrates

q: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
h:
“The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: He who is untrue to his own cause cannot command the respect of others.
h:

Albert Einstein

q: Whatever you believe with feeling becomes your reality.
h:
“Whatever you believe with feeling becomes your reality. ” —
Brian Tracy

q: Failure is just information and an opportunity to change your course.
h:
“Failure is just information and an opportunity to change your course.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: The only defense against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.
h:
“The only defense against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.” —
John Locke

q: Silence is the great teacher and to learn its lessons you must pay attention to it.
h:
“Silence is the great teacher and to learn its lessons you must pay attention to it.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
h:
“Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.” —
Dalai Lama

q: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
h:
“You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.
h:
“Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Being ignorant is not so much a shame, as being unwilling to learn.
h:
“Being ignorant is not so much a shame, as being unwilling to learn.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Having an open mind is one of the most important qualities we can possess. Once our minds close, we stop evolving.
h:
“Having an open mind is one of the most important qualities we can possess. Once our minds close, we stop evolving.” —
Yanni

q: Be truthful about your emotions, and use your mind and emotions in your favor, not against yourself.
h:
“Be truthful about your emotions, and use your mind and emotions in your favor, not against yourself.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.
h:
“Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: Your next step is simple. You are the first domino.
h:
“Your next step is simple. You are the first domino.” —
Gary Keller

q: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
h:
“Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.” —
Helen Keller

q: The greatest value of a picture is when it forces us to notice what we never expected to see.
h:
“The greatest value of a picture is when it forces us to notice what we never expected to see.” —
John Tukey

q: The only limits in your life are those that you set yourself.
h:
“The only limits in your life are those that you set yourself.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count.
h:
“Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Most people do not really want freedom, because freedom involves responsibility, and most people are frightened of responsibility.
h:
“Most people do not really want freedom, because freedom involves responsibility, and most people are frightened of responsibility.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Only when I fall do I get up again.
h:
“Only when I fall do I get up again.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Conscience is a man's compass.
h:
“Conscience is a man's compass. ” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.
h:
“One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.” —
A.A. Milne

q: Happiness is pretty simple: someone to love, something to do, something to look forward to.
h:
“Happiness is pretty simple: someone to love, something to do, something to look forward to.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.
h:
“Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
h:
“We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.” —
Seneca

q: The trouble with most of us is that we'd rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.
h:
“The trouble with most of us is that we'd rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Our stories may be singular, but our destination is shared.
h:
“Our stories may be singular, but our destination is shared.” —
Barack Obama

q: The goal is not to be perfect by the end, the goal is to be better today.
h:
“The goal is not to be perfect by the end, the goal is to be better today.” —
Simon Sinek

q: The finish line is just the beginning of a whole new race.
h:
“The finish line is just the beginning of a whole new race.” —
Unknown

q: Nothing can survive without food. Everything we consume acts either to heal us or to poison us.
h:
“Nothing can survive without food. Everything we consume acts either to heal us or to poison us.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: He who can, does.
h:
“He who can, does.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Empty yourself of everything - let the mind become still.
h:

Lao Tzu

q: When the time is gone, you can never get it back.
h:
“When the time is gone, you can never get it back.” —
Stephen King

q: Go as far as you can see and you will see further.
h:
“Go as far as you can see and you will see further. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Learn from the rejection and turn it into an opportunity!
h:
“Learn from the rejection and turn it into an opportunity!” —

q: Decide whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying.
h:

Amelia Earhart

q: Men are anxious to improve their circumstances but are unwilling to improve themselves; they therefore remain bound.
h:
“Men are anxious to improve their circumstances but are unwilling to improve themselves; they therefore remain bound.” —
James Allen

q: If you can't, you must. If you must, you can.
h:
“If you can't, you must. If you must, you can.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Your best life will not be found in comfort. It will be found in fighting for what you believe in.
h:

Maxime Lagace

q: Be fascinated instead of frustrated.
h:
“Be fascinated instead of frustrated.” —
Jim Rohn

q: What is planted in each person's soul will sprout.
h:

Rumi

q: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
h:
“Change your thoughts and you change your world.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Tradition is the illusion of permanence.
h:
“Tradition is the illusion of permanence. ” —
Woody Allen

q: Everything starts with a dream. A particle of our imagination that teases us of what the future could be like, as long as we fight for it.
h:

Gurbaksh Chahal

q: Be approximately right rather than exactly wrong.
h:
“Be approximately right rather than exactly wrong.” —
John Tukey

q: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
h:

Alan Watts

q: A thing must be loved before it is lovable.
h:
“A thing must be loved before it is lovable.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: For fast-acting relief try slowing down.
h:

q: Lying can never save us from another lie.
h:

Vaclav Havel
